content: vivaldi autumn mitts autumn is the third pair of mitts in the four seasons collection this is autumn vibrant leaves turned ocher sienna burgundy crimson and gold a sense of quiet as they flutter and fall and the earth settles into a season of stillness darkness comes early beckoning us to turn inward and rest this lace pattern is rhythmic intuitive and easy to memorize it is written for magic loop but can easily be adapted for dpns please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 to determine your size wrap a flexible measuring tape around your hand below the knuckles excluding your thumb sizes tiny 7 0 smallish 7 5 larger 8 0 materials tiny fingering yarn 150 200 yards us 2 2 75mm circular needle 32 inches smallish sport/dk yarn 150 200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle 32 inches larger worsted yarn 150 200 yards us 6 4 0mm circular needle 32 inches notions 1 locking stitch marker 1 additional marker waste yarn and tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations co - cast on using the backward loop method k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop p - purl pm - place marker sk2p - slip next stitch knitwise knit 2 stitches together pass slipped stitch over k3tog - knit 3 stitches together sm - slip marker st s - stitch es yo - yarn over this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 right mitt twisted rib cuff cast on 48 sts using a stretchy cast on method and divide evenly onto needle 1 and needle 2 being careful not to twist prepare to join and work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round k1tbl p1 for 10 rounds right wrist set up row needle 1 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 k1tbl 17 times p1 k1tbl p1 repeat on needle 2 work rows1 24 of lace chart lace encircles the entire wrist so row 1 - 24 are each worked twice once per needle 1 & needle 2 right hand/thumb from this point forward the back of the hand needle 1 is worked from lace chart row 25 - 48 the palm needle 2 is worked in stockinette with thumb shaping needle 1 needle 2 round 25 work chart row 25 kfb kfb pm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 26 work chart row 26 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 27 work chart row 27 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 28 work chart row 28 k4 sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1 k1tbl p1 round 29 work chart row 29 kfb k2 kfb sm k1tbl p1 k16 k1tbl p1
